title: Highest Increase in Methane Emissions
description: Equatorial Guinea experienced a staggering 2942.83% increase in methane emissions from 1990 to 2023, marking one of the highest increases globally.

title: Highest Increase in Total Greenhouse Gas Emissions
description: The country's total greenhouse gas emissions surged by 3674.11% from 1990 to 2023, placing it among the top contributors to global emissions growth.

title: Lowest Bank Capital to Assets Ratio
description: In 2022, Equatorial Guinea had a bank capital to assets ratio of just 1.15%, one of the lowest globally, indicating potential financial instability.

title: Highest Rate of Nonperforming Loans
description: With 55.41% of loans being nonperforming in 2022, Equatorial Guinea's banking sector faces significant challenges.

title: Lowest Electricity Production from Renewables
description: In 2021, Equatorial Guinea's electricity production from renewable sources was -23.72% of the total, indicating a heavy reliance on non-renewable energy.

title: Lowest Primary Completion Rate for Males
description: As of 2015, only 37.44% of males completed primary education, highlighting significant educational challenges.

title: High Percentage of Children Out of School
description: In 2015, 62.33% of male children were out of school, one of the highest rates globally, indicating a critical need for educational reform.

title: Lowest Percentage of Trained Teachers in Secondary Education
description: Only 11.19% of teachers in lower secondary education were trained in 2015, reflecting a significant gap in educational quality.

title: Low Voice and Accountability
description: In 2022, Equatorial Guinea ranked in the lower percentile for voice and accountability, indicating limited political freedoms.
